byline.contributor: Andrew Roth and Sophia Kishkovsky contributed reporting.

abstract: Russian Pres Vladimir Putin holds rally and concert in Moscow to celebrate first anniversary of Russia's annexation of Crimea; at same time, Russian-backed separatists in Ukraine warn that fragile cease-fire there is at risk because Ukrainian government has not moved quickly enough to grant them political autonomy.
lead_paragraph: President Vladimir V. Putin led an anniversary rally just outside the Kremlin walls as Russian-backed separatists in Ukraine warned that a cease-fire there was at risk of collapsing.

headline.main: A Year After Seizing Crimea, Putin Celebrates as Ukraine Seethes
headline.print_headline: A Year After Seizing Crimea, Putin Celebrates as Ukraine Seethes

snippet: President Vladimir V. Putin led an anniversary rally just outside the Kremlin walls as Russian-backed separatists in Ukraine warned that a cease-fire there was at risk of collapsing.
